items.title: Use for Signup Registration
items.body: Not sure if this has been asked already. But how do you use this for verifying the signup requests to django? I'm using contrib.auth.user and allauth.

items.title: reCAPTCHA not being required for form submission
Django 1.11 excluded by setup.py?
items.body:
According to the README Django 1.11 is still supported, but your setup.py file has:

```Python
install_requires=[
        'django>1.11,<3.0',
    ],
```
which forces django 2.x.  That makes installing it a bit tricky.  Am I missing something or should this actually be `django>=1.11,<3.0` ?

items.title: django 3.0 support
items.body:
pip install django-recaptcha cause version rollback
Collecting django<3.0,>1.11

items.title: Tests not working
items.body:
Hi.
I used to write my tests with `os.environ['RECAPTCHA_TESTING']` = 'True' ...` (like described in #150 )
This not work with the current version.
Is there a new way to do this?

items.title: django 1.11 support & pip
items.body:
According to the documentation (https://github.com/praekelt/django-recaptcha#requirements), django 1.11 is supported.  However when I attempt to add django-recaptcha to to my python install with pip either django gets updated to 2.1.x.  If I try to downgrade django back to 1.11 I get the following error:

> django-recaptcha 2.0.2 has requirement django<2.3,>1.11, but you'll have django 1.11 which is incompatible.

setup.py contains the following dependency:https://github.com/praekelt/django-recaptcha/blob/d09bd708c8d7a0764cfc5fd9bfdb1f623c4df557/setup.py#L19
        
It seems that either the documentation or setup.py is incorrect.  According to https://www.djangoproject.com/download/#supported-versions 1.11 will be supported through April 2020.

items.title: Deprecation Warning even with NOCAPTCHA=True
items.body:
Maybe I'm missing something here, but from what I can tell release `1.5.0` and specifically 76acbad9148ce75e4316b997609d1e1f0ef3cf89 means django-recaptcha raises a warning whenever `submit` is called regardless of whether `NOCAPTCHA` is set and what it's set to.

If so, that seems to me a odd way of warning users about a future deprecation. The warning should only occur if `NOCAPTCHA=False` or is not set.

items.title: Django recaptcha with ajax mode is loading old js file
items.body:
I get this error:
> Failed to execute 'write' on 'Document': It isn't possible to write into a document from an asynchronously-loaded external script unless it is explicitly opened.

When importing recaptcha file:

> <script type="text/javascript" src="{% static 'js/recaptcha_ajax.js' %}"></script>
So I though I will see what is inside. And there is old Captcha v2 code:
```js
var RecaptchaState = {
    challenge : 'SHUTDOWN',
    timeout : 1800,
    lang : '',
    server : 'https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api/',
    site : 'SHUTDOWN',
    error_message : '',
    programming_error : '',
    is_incorrect : false,
    rtl : false,
    payload_url : 'https://www.gstatic.com/recaptcha/images/v1_unsupported.png'
};

document.write('<scr'+'ipt type="text/javascript" s'+'rc="' + RecaptchaState.server + 'js/recaptcha.js"></scr'+'ipt>');
```
I want to ask, how to repair this error and get AJAX mode working? Is there any JS file of Recaptcha v2 with compatibility of Django Recaptcha? Or should I use another package?

items.title: Make `NOCAPTCHA=True` the default
items.body:
Following the installation instructions leaves you with an unusable v1 reCAPTCHA that no longer works. I even started looking for other packages because I thought this package didn't support v2... only to find out about the `NOCAPTCHA` setting 2 hours later.

I'd vote for making `NOCAPTCHA = True` the default behavior (or even remove the toggle all together) because the older version no longer works. Sites should all use the modern defaults instead.

items.title: Adds data- to all attributes.

Therefore you end up with `data-id="id_captcha"` instead of `id="id_captcha"`
Should whitelist only the ones that Google will use.

items.body:
I use django-recaptcha for my fresh project and add this modul on login page Site administration. reCaptcha render smooth but after login Authentication and Authorization page is hidden. So our user cannot create user or group if recaptcha activated. here is the code forms.py `from django import forms from captcha.fields import ReCaptchaField class FormWithCaptcha(forms.Form): captcha = ReCaptchaField() ` admin.py `from django.contrib.admin.sites import AdminSite from django.conf import settings class MyAdminWithReCaptcha(AdminSite): login_form = MyAdminLoginForm login_template = settings.TEMPLATES_LOGIN admin.site = MyAdminWithReCaptcha()` i add captcha on template login.html `
{{ form.captcha }} {{ form.captcha.errors }}
`

items.title: Google changed its customization options
items.body: Google changed its customization options, and both the link in the README and in the code (https://code.google.com/apis/recaptcha/docs/customization.html) returns a 404 page. The new customization options are now documented [here](https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/display#js_param).

items.title: RECAPTCHA_USE_SSL=True as default?
items.body: Seems like a good security setting. Is there anything stopping it from being a default?

items.title: Custom style attribute
items.body: I can't see the attribute for specifying custom CSS style to the ReCaptcha widget, so I'm asking whether that can be included in the next version? Thanks!

items.title: Requires Django 1.9?
items.body:
I'm currently using django-recaptcha v1.0.3, with Django 1.8.11, and was about to upgrade to the latest version (1.0.5). But when I `pip install --upgrade django-recaptcha` it tries to install Django 1.9.4. Presumably because of the `django` requirement added in [this commit](https://github.com/praekelt/django-recaptcha/commit/b148a904d8de88718ace087e5eb89d44b75f272f#diff-2eeaed663bd0d25b7e608891384b7298).

It's not the end of the world for me -- I'm planning on upgrading to Django 1.9 soon anyway -- but it seems odd to require the very latest Django, essentially dropping support for the Long Term Support 1.8. Or have I misunderstood something?

items.title: Bug with a mutable default argument in __init__ of ReCaptchaField
items.body:
See https://github.com/praekelt/django-recaptcha/blob/develop/captcha/fields.py#L26

I was trying to figure out why when the lang attr is set the first time it gets stuck to whatever the first value is.  Then I found that subsequent calls to `client.display_html()` were being handled attrs with the lang key already set.

items.title: Django 1.8 support
items.body:
As part of the preparation of upgrading one of my projects to 1.8 LTS I'm considering each and every dependency and hence came across this one. I figured I might as well shoot out an issue for 1.8 support. 

Roughly the following needs to be done:
- [ ] Run tests on 1.8
- [ ] Fix any issues that might result
- [ ] Document supported Django and Python releases.

items.title: Rename application to recaptcha
items.body: Python package named as `django-recaptcha`, but application name is `captcha`. This is not obvious and creates collision with other captcha extensions, such as [django-simple-captcha](https://github.com/mbi/django-simple-captcha).

items.title: NO captcha recaptcha - are you planning to upgrade to new reCaptcha?
app name collision with django-simple-captcha
items.body: Suggest to rename you app 'recaptcha' to avoid collision when installed on same project with https://github.com/mbi/django-simple-captcha. Will be cool :+1:

items.title: Python 3 support should be advertised in setup.py
items.body: The changelog says Python 3 is supported, but metadata does not advertise this, which confuses aggregators such as djangopackages.com

```
raise forms.util.ValidationError(

)
```

on:

```
raise forms.ValidationError(

)
```

in fields.py

items.title: Format of site key was invalid
items.body:
After installing `django-recaptcha 0.0.6`, adding the the keys as described in the `README.rst` and adding the recaptcha to a form:

``` python
class MyForm(forms.ModelForm):
    captcha = ReCaptchaField(attrs={'theme' : 'clean'})
```

When I open the form template, the label "Captcha\* is shown and the value of the field is "Input error: k: Format of site key was invalid".

How can I fix that?

Thanks you,

Nikolay

items.title: Testing with override_settings instead of os.environ
items.body:
Today the `RECAPTCHA_TESTING` flag is an environment variable.

I propose we enable it to be a settings parameter or an environment variable (for backward compatibility).

New Django releases have a decorator to `@override_settings` that could make testing with `django-recaptcha` very straight forward.

Instead of writing:

``` python
class SomeTestCase(TestCase):
    def setUp(self):
         os.environ['RECAPTCHA_TESTING'] = 'True'

    def tearDown(self):
         del os.environ['RECAPTCHA_TESTING']
```

We could write:

``` python
@override_settings(RECAPTCHA_TESTING=True)
class SomeTestCase(TestCase):
    pass
```

This would also enable the flag value to be a `bool` instead of a `string`.

If you're up for it, I can submit a PR.

items.title: ReCaptcha widget validation
Registration integration
items.body:
Is it really necessary to depend on `django-registration` in `setup.py`?

I see `RegistrationFormCaptcha` that inherits the form from `registration` but I think that it is not enough to require such a dependency.

The reason why I need to not depend on `django-registration` is because I'm using `django-registration-me` that is the fork of the first one based on `MongoEngine`.

Any suggestions?

items.body:

``` python
captcha = ReCaptchaField(attrs={'theme' : 'clean', 'lang' : 'pt'})
```

The source shows that it seems to be rendering ok:

``` html
<script type="text/javascript">var RecaptchaOptions = {

}</script>
```

```
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 379, in execute
    self.fetch_command(subcommand).run_from_argv(self.argv)
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 191, in run_from_argv
    self.execute(*args, **options.__dict__)
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 220, in execute
    output = self.handle(*args, **options)
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/south/management/commands/migrate.py", line 105, in handle
    ignore_ghosts = ignore_ghosts,
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/south/migration/__init__.py", line 171, in migrate_app
    applied = check_migration_histories(applied, delete_ghosts, ignore_ghosts)
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/south/migration/__init__.py", line 74, in check_migration_histories
    m = h.get_migration()
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/south/models.py", line 34, in get_migration
    return self.get_migrations().migration(self.migration)
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/south/models.py", line 31, in get_migrations
    return Migrations(self.app_name)
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/south/migration/base.py", line 60, in __call__
    self.instances[app_label] = super(MigrationsMetaclass, self).__call__(app_label_to_app_module(app_label), **kwds)
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/south/migration/base.py", line 88, in __init__
    self.set_application(application, force_creation, verbose_creation)
  File "/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/south/migration/base.py", line 160, in set_application
    raise exceptions.NoMigrations(application)
south.exceptions.NoMigrations: Application '<module 'captcha' from '/home/erik/virtualenv/bb/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/captcha/__init__.pyc'>' has no migrations.
```

If I delete the models.py everything works again. I would've create a pull request for this, but I can't seem to find any conclusive Django documentation on whether or not an app MUST have a models.py, even if it's empty.

items.title: Fail better when there is no config
items.body:
When trying to access a URL such as `/admin/` with no config or only one config string specified everything fails. The problem with this is that it tells you your view is failing, not your config.

Is there any way that it could display the error as Django does while in debug mode?

items.title: Remove django-registration as a install requirement in setup.py
items.body: django-registration is not _actually_ a requirement for the library to work. This should not be required during install time, so it should be removed from setup.py `install_requires` param. It conflicts with another app I am using (actually a fork of django-registration) that is also named `registration`.

items.title: reCaptcha does not work with IE9
items.body:
I'm not sure if this is a problem with this module or generally with reCaptcha but under IE9 the reCaptcha always fails saying the field is required. Looking around this appeared to be a common issue elsewhere last year, but it is unclear what fix is available (other than putting IE9 into IE8 compatibility mode) - there may be an updated version of the reCaptcha code?

Apologies for vagueness, but it's rather confusing.

items.title: Error when request.META['REMOTE_ADDR'] is not defined
items.body:
Hi, I got an error when using this module because for some reason or another request.META['REMOTE_ADDR'] was not set by my django instance.  I think this probably has to do with the way that the request is being proxied.  I don't think that REMOTE_ADDR is always something that can be depended on as being set all the time.  I made the following change which I think solves the issue.  

Solution: 

https://github.com/JoeJasinski/django-recaptcha/commit/5fdb9bc22dca944758285c0defc5560076213f81

Original Error:

 File "/jaz/sites/jazstudios/lib/python2.6/site-packages/captcha/fields.py", line 53, in clean
   remoteip=self.get_remote_ip(), use_ssl=self.use_ssl)

 File "/jaz/sites/jazstudios/lib/python2.6/site-packages/captcha/fields.py", line 44, in get_remote_ip
   return request.META['REMOTE_ADDR']

KeyError: 'REMOTE_ADDR'

items.title: widget.html noscript code doesn't work when JavaScript is disabled
items.body: The widget.html template doesn't work when JavaScript is disabled  because the iframe src in the noscript is incorrent. The src should be src="{{api_server}}/noscript?k={{public_key}}{{error_param}}"

items.title: Check settings.DEBUG to allow unit tests
items.body:
Does django-recaptcha currently allow unit tests to successfully post a form that contains a ReCaptchaField()?

I have a form that contains the recaptcha field and I can't post the form from my unit tests as there is no way for me to get around the recaptcha field by failing or passing it intentionally.

One way would be to check for settings.DEBUG == True and allow certain responses to pass or fail accordingly. Only when settings.DEBUG == False then enforce the check strictly.

items.title: Support recaptcha themes
items.body: http://code.google.com/apis/recaptcha/docs/customization.html

items.title: wrong dependency on django-registration version
items.body: In PyPM recaptcha depends on django-registration>=0.8-alpha-1 while the latest version for the later is 0.7

items.title: Allow runtime configuration of recaptcha.
items.body:
Right now the recaptcha settings are coming from django.conf.settings, but I would like to allow users edit the keys from some admin-like interface.

Will it be possible to give public and private keys as parameters to **init**()?

Thanks.

items.title: Module fell out of date.
items.body:
Hello, 

This module is published on pypi, but the version there dates back to June 2010.
Is it possible to update it? Looks like there were some good improvements on other branches.

Thank you.

Evgeny.

items.title: Module lacks documentation
items.body:
Hi there,

Could someone expand the README file on how to install and use this module.
Thx.

Evgeny.
